Reason: The configuration option 'windows_timer_interval' is classified as performance-sensitive. The reason for this classification is that the 'windows_timer_interval' configuration directly affects the system performance at the system level by adjusting the system timer on Windows from the default 15ms down to the minimum of 1ms. This adjustment impacts timer intervals, thread scheduling, driver interrupts, etc., which are time-extensive operations. The code context shows that the value of 'windows_timer_interval' is retrieved from the configuration and used to start and end the Windows timer period in the activate and runMayThrow methods, respectively. These operations contribute significantly to the execution time and system performance, leading to notable performance variations.
